Sentencas: A portable commercial solid-oxide fuel cell that consisted of 56 stacked cells and used an indirect internal reforming strategy with a rhodium catalyst on an yttria-stabilized zirconia structure for its reformer and a nickel anode on an yttria-stabilized zirconia structure electrolyte was tested with propane fuel intentionally blended with 0 to 15 ppmv H2S.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The voltages of cell pairs and stack were recorded during 7-h poison and recovery tests.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Results indicated that with higher H2S concentrations, the rate of stack voltage decrease could vary from 181.4 mV/h at 3 ppmv to 432.0 mV/h at 15 ppmv.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The voltage losses of individual cell pairs showed a consistent trend as well.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Results from recovery tests indicated that a longer recovery time may be necessary at higher H2S concentration.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy was employed to better understand the role of varying phenomena within the solid-oxide fuel cell.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: An equivalent circuit model was constructed to fit electrochemical impedance spectral data that was taken at the system level.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Effects of individual components within the system (fuel cell, battery, and DC/DC converter), determined by using electrochemical impedance spectra, were then used to deduce the behaviour of the SOFC.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: A clear charge transfer resistance increase was observed due to H2S poisoning, consistent with the blocking of active sites on the catalyst in the anode layer.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The effect was found to be completely reversible by a period of operation with sulfide-free fuel.
Titulo: Understanding hydrogen sulfide impact on a portable, commercial, propane-powered solid-oxide fuel cell
